oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Orders assigning Christopher Ammons to his Vietnam unit
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two-page typed Special Order No. 188 contains military orders for a number of individuals plus a short note to his parents concerning his orders. On page two of the document are the orders assigning Christopher Ammons to his Vietnam unit. The note is dated August 16, 1967.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Ammons, Christopher D., 1948-: Vietnam War, 1961-1975; United States Army. Infantry Division, 1st; Fort McClellan (Ala.); Military orders
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Christopher Ammons enlisted in the U.S. Army on June 1, 1967. He did his basic training at Fort Campbell, Kentucky, and infantry training at Fort McClellan, Alabama. He was sent to Vietnam in early November 1967, and assigned to the First Infantry Division in Company A, 1st Battalion, 16th Infantry.
